annotations.decision: Trisomy 21
primary pulmonary hypertension
transferred from the [**Hospital1 18**] NICU to the [**Hospital3 **] SCN.
Antenatal ultrasound said to be normal but full report not available at time of delivery.
Prenatal screens complete and unremarkable.
B negative, antibody negative,
hepatitis B surface negative, RPR nonreactive,
rubella immune, GBS negative
Delivery by cesarean section
Apgars of 7 at one minute, 8 at five minutes.
Neonatal Intensive Care Unit team called
grunting, flaring and retracting
On examination at that time normal cardiac examination and lung examinations
. Tone slightly decreased throughout
Nipples not hypoplastic
No brush filled spots.
Occiput not flattened
Subsequently went to newborn nursery
6 hours of age the patient was noted to have cyanotic episodes
Seen by the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit team
desaturating on room.
Brought to the Newborn Intensive Care Unit
with blow-by O2 and saturations in the high 70s noted.
Placed on continuous positive airway pressure with 100% O2
Pink active infant with vigorous cry. Skin without lesions.
Head, eyes, ears, nose and throat with thin upper lip, somewhat prominent tongue. Eyes with slightly downward slant. Occiput normal.
Cor normal, S1, S2 without murmur. Precordium normally active. Four extremity blood pressure without gradient
Lungs clear with fair aeration.
Abdomen soft, nondistended, no masses
Toes normally spaced. No simian creases
Axial tone slightly decreased. Appendicular tone normal
Neurologic otherwise normal
Spine intact. Hips normal
. Anus patent.
Chest x-ray
shows relatively clear lung fields, heart size slightly increased, RA prominent, TBF normal to slightly decreased.
. Electrocardiogram
normal for age.
continuous positive airway pressure of 6 cm requiring 85 to 100% O2
ECHO
revealed pulmonary hypertension
Oxygen therapy was continued
remained on CPAP
transitioned to oxygen
Oxygen requirement gradually weaned from 100% to 30%, and she then transitioned to a nasal cannula O2
Arterial gas on nasal cannula O2
Nasal cannula requirement weaned over next several days
initial CXR
did suggest a small left pneumothorax
On [**6-4**] echocardiogram was performed

showed right ventricular hypertension, right ventricular dilatation with moderate right ventricular dysfunction, normal left ventricular size and systolic flow, patent foramen ovale, bidirectional low velocity flow across the patent ductus arteriosus consistent with systemic pulmonary arterial pressure
Overall findings were consistent with primary pulmonary hypertension.
is currently cardiovascularly stable.
one normal saline bolus for poor perfusion
maintenance IV fluid at 60 ml per kilo per day of D10W and ultimately transitioned to receive some parenteral nutrition intravenously
double lumen UVC line inserted
an umbilical arterial line to monitor blood pressures
umbilical arterial line was discontinued on day of life 2
double lumen UVC line was removed on day of life 3.
Enteral feedings were introduced on day of life 3.
full enteral feedings of breast milk or Enfamil 20 ad lib
currently taking in greater than 120 ml per kilo per day. She is voiding and stooling, has had no gastrointestinal issues.
peripheral IV infiltrate
followed by the plastic surgery team
Digits are warm and well perfused. The skin over the right dorsal hand has had areas of sloughing.
some expected epidermolysis. Plastic surgery anticipates there may be some full thickness skin loss but from spontaneous activity appears to have normal extension and flexion and a good strong grasp.
Currently xeroform and Telfa dressings are applied with dry sterile dressing.
Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 5385**] to follow up with the family in one to two weeks after discharge
Initial KUB
showed some suggestion of pneumatosis,
but subsequent films were within normal limits, and exam normalized rapidly.
No photo therapy has been indicated.
started on ampicillin and gentamicin
Blood cultures remained negative
antibiotics were discontinued
with trisomy- 21 chromosomes were sent and were positive for trisomy-21
referred to the Downs Program at the [**Hospital3 1810**].

Parents have also been working with the occupational therapist, [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 38698**]. She can be reached at [**Telephone/Fax (1) 41276**]. They will be followed by early intervention after discharge and area aware that referral will occur prior to discharge.
slightly hypotonic consistent with trisomy-21.
Audiology screening has not been performed at time of transfer
Ophthalmology: Eye examination has not been performed.

[**First Name8 (NamePattern2) 553**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) **] is the social worker who has been working with this family. She can be reached by calling [**Telephone/Fax (1) 64034**] and having her paged if there are any additional questions.
